line_2: Your native soil was right ill-willie;
But may ye flourish like a lily,
I'll toast you in my hindmost gillie,
The tither was a ploughman's collie,

line_1: Should I believe, my coaxin billie,
line_2: I Gat your letter, winsome Willie;

line_1: Should I believe, my coaxin billie,
line_2: Wi' gratefu' heart I thank you brawlie;

line_1: Should I believe, my coaxin billie,
line_2: Tho' I maun say't, I wad be silly,

line_1: Mark how they grace Lord Umbra, or Sir Billy.
line_2: To sigh for Ribbands if thou art so silly,
An' Livistone, the bauld Sir Willie;
